title: One man dies in Lamb County tire blowout Wednesday afternoon (UPDATED)
content:
One man died Wednesday after a tire blowout in Lamb County, according to a statement by the Texas Department of Public Safety.

Ernesto Contreras-Esquivel, 51, of Olton was driving a pickup truck eastbound on U.S. 70 around 4:20 p.m., when the right rear tire blew, causing the vehicle to drift to the south side of U.S. 70, the statement said.

He then overcorrected and drifted over the westbound lane and into the north barrow ditch. The vehicle rolled one time and came to a stop on the driver’s side, according to the statement.

Esquivel, who was not wearing a seatbelt, was ejected, according to the statement.

Dionisio Bosque Jr., 34, of Olton was a passenger in the pickup truck and was not wearing a seatbelt either, the statement said.

Bosque was taken to the Covenant Hospital in Plainview, and was later transported to University Medical Center in Lubbock by helicopter, according to the statement.

Bosque was disharged from UMC, said UMC spokesperson Eric Finley.
